decks.notes: The main goal of this UWx Control deck is to control the game with a variety of spells and abilities, ultimately outlasting the opponent by managing the board and countering threats. The deck features powerful control cards like Snapcaster Mage, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Counterbalance, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's plays. Combined with powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, this deck aims to control the tempo of the game and eventually close it out with powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels.

The main concept of this deck is to use efficient aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, while also controlling the opponent's hand and deck with cards like Gitaxian Probe and Spell Pierce. The mana base is streamlined to maximize consistency and efficiency, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan by playing efficient creatures and using counter spells and removal. By using cards like Delver of Secrets, Stoneforge Mystic, and True-Name Nemesis to pressure the opponent, along with disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Stifle, the deck aims to control the game and win through aggressive plays. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its creatures and create additional threats on the battlefield.

The main idea of this Legacy Aggro-Delver deck is to quickly establish board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board through cards like Abrupt Decay and Stifle, while setting up card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Brainstorm. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements, with fetch lands like Polluted Delta and Verdant Catacombs. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggression and disruption.

This deck aims to maximize early pressure and disruption by utilizing an efficient creature base and powerful instants. Delver of Secrets and Stoneforge Mystic provide threats that must be answered quickly, while efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares help keep opponents off balance. Counterspells like Daze and Force of Will ensure that key threats resolve, while cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder help smooth out draws. The deck also utilizes disruptive lands like Wasteland to further disrupt opponents' game plans. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a quick clock and disrupt opponents enough to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Stoneforge Mystic while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The key strategy is to apply pressure early on while using efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares to maintain board control. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance the aggression of the creatures. Card draw and selection through Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe help ensure consistent and effective plays.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and dominate the late game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. The mana base is designed to provide access to all three colors efficiently, allowing the deck to cast its spells consistently and effectively.

The main concept of this Legacy Aggro-Burn deck is to deal as much damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. The deck utilizes a combination of low-cost burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt, along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Eidolon of the Great Revel to apply pressure and win the game before the opponent can stabilize. Cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Price of Progress are included to provide additional reach and punish opponents for playing non-basic lands.

This deck focuses on cheating big threats into play quickly through the use of mana acceleration cards like Seething Song and Simian Spirit Guide. It aims to disrupt opponents by locking them out of their non-basic lands with cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void. The primary win condition is to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play with Sneak Attack or Through the Breach, overwhelming the opponent with their immense power. Despite being mono-red, the deck has the potential to win games quickly with its explosive plays.

The deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence with efficient creature threats like Knight of the Reliquary, backed up by disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Gaddock Teeg. The combination of Mother of Runes and Swords to Plowshares provides a strong defense against opposing threats, while Stoneforge Mystic can tutor up powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte or Sword of Fire and Ice to bolster the aggression. The deck also includes a Dark Depths combo for a potential alternate win condition. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly overwhelming the opponent with versatile creatures and disruptive plays.

The deck focuses on using low-cost spells to control the opponent's plays while deploying efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Nimble Mongoose, and Delver of Secrets. By disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain tempo advantage throughout. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for quick access to all necessary colors. This Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck excels at maintaining board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and storm count to cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. It utilizes rituals, fast mana sources, cantrips, and discard spells to enable explosive turns and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The Burning Wish package allows for flexible access to a variety of sideboard options to deal with different matchups. The deck aims to execute its combo as efficiently as possible while navigating through the opponent's disruption to win the game in a single turn.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, supported by efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Fire Covenant. The deck also includes disruption elements like Daze, Stifle, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells. The deck's strategy is to maintain early pressure and disrupt the opponent's resources to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Legacy High Tide Combo deck is to generate large amounts of mana using High Tide and Candelabra of Tawnos, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and win the game quickly. The deck includes card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sensei's Divining Top to find the combo pieces needed. Counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm help protect the combo while Cunning Wish offers additional flexibility in fetching key cards from the sideboard. Time Spiral is used to refill your hand and generate even more mana for explosive turns.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. Stoneforge Mystic helps to tutor for equipment such as Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, providing additional threats and utility. True-Name Nemesis is a resilient creature that can be difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily building up its own board presence to ultimately outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to combo off using Elves to generate mana and draw cards, leading to a quick and powerful finish with Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck includes key cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to help find combo pieces quickly, while also running plenty of mana sources like Gaea's Cradle. With the ability to swarm the board with Elves and generate massive amounts of mana, this deck can overwhelm opponents and win the game in just a few turns.
